title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Maine principal James Black criticized for wearing ICE agent costume with bulletproof vest for Halloween.
The incident occurred off school grounds; parents and staff contacted school district with concerns.
Advocacy group Project Relief Maine condemned the costume, citing trauma for immigrant students fearing ICE.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez cleared concussion protocol after leaving Sunday's game with a head injury in the fourth quarter.
Gonzalez's injury occurred during a 40-yard catch by Atlanta's Drake London, who finished with 118 yards and three touchdowns.
New England won the game by a one-point margin due to a missed extra point by the Falcons.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End residents collected 180 needles in six days at Southwest Corridor Park after a public safety meeting.
City distributes over 81,000 needles monthly as harm reduction; residents urge stricter drug use prevention measures.
Residents expressed safety concerns over drug crisis, demanding increased city efforts for needle pick-up and recovery services.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant praises Jayson Tatum's Achilles rehab, noting his advanced recovery progress compared to typical timelines for such injuries.
Durant commends Tatum for dunking six months post-injury, saying he didn't feel that confident during his own recovery.
Tatum considers returning later this season, a departure from expected timelines; Durant says Tatum's return is feasible.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings played pivotal roles in Patriots' win amid personal losses.
Douglas posted a career-high 100 receiving yards, contributing significantly to the Patriots' 24-23 victory.
Jennings scored his first NFL touchdown, stepping up in place of injured starter Rhamondre Stevenson.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots narrowly defeated the Falcons 24-23 at Gillette Stadium despite turnovers by quarterback Drake Maye.
Mike Vrabel urged the Patriots to embrace their success and focus on the positive aspects of their performance.
Drake Maye threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns against a strong Falcons defense despite making costly errors.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Setti Warren, first African-American mayor of Newton, Massachusetts, has died at 55. Cause of death unannounced.
Warren served as Newton's mayor from 2009 to 2018, enhancing public schools, transportation, and the innovation economy.
He held roles at FEMA, served in Iraq, and was Director of the Institute of Politics at Harvard Kennedy School.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to six with a close victory over the Falcons, despite key turnovers by Drake Maye.
DeMario Douglas achieves his first 100-yard game, excelling as a deep threat with a 58-yard catch.
Marcus Jones struggles against Falcons, giving up 14 points due to height mismatch with receiver Drake London.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A survey found 33.7% of Boston residents feel 'less safe' downtown, down from 70.6% in November 2024.
92% of participants still see public safety as an urgent downtown issue despite reduced feelings of insecurity.
Downtown safety summit covered drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure, noting improved retail vacancy rates.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots narrowly defeated Falcons 24-23 at Gillette Stadium to extend their win streak to six games.
Rookie QB Drake Maye threw for 259 yards but committed two turnovers that led to Falcons' points.
Parker Romo's missed extra point sealed the Patriots' victory after Atlanta's late touchdown attempt.
